intro: Chamaecytisus ratisbonensis subsp. vadasii, commonly known as the Vadasii buckthorn, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dense, thorny growth and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers in late spring, which are followed by small, woody pods containing seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
